info.title: AppsFlyer Data Contract for app_id=id123456789
info.description: Data contract for AppsFlyer raw data (app_id=id123456789), using Pull API for daily batch processing and Push API for real-time streaming. Data is stored in Apache Iceberg tables on MinIO, processed by Spark, Flink, and Airflow.

pull.description: Daily batch data from AppsFlyer Pull API

push.description: Real-time streaming data from AppsFlyer Push API

terms.usage: Data for internal analytics and dashboarding, restricted to ProductA Analytics and Data Science teams.

installs_report.description: Batch-processed non-organic installs from Pull API

attributed_touch_type.description: Classifies the engagement. Set by AppsFlyer after the engagement was matched with an install

attributed_touch_time.description: Time of attributed touch, attributed engagement

install_time.description: UA: First launch after install. Retargeting: First launch after re-engagement/re-attribution

event_name.description: The attribution event type or the in-app event name sent by the app

event_value.description: Detailed event content sent from the SDK

event_revenue.description: Value of revenue using Event Revenue Currency

event_revenue_currency.description: The event revenue currency code reported to the SDK

event_revenue_usd.description: The amount of revenue. The currency will depend on the reporting tool used. Preferred or selected means the app-specific currency set in the app settings

is_receipt_validated.description: TRUE/FALSE/NULL when implemented in the SDK, empty otherwise

media_source.description: The media source attributed to an event or restricted

af_keywords.description: Word(s) used in the user's online search. As reported by the ad network

af_adset.description: Adset name, identifies a group that contains one or more ads

af_adset_id.description: Adset ID, identifies a group that contains one or more ads

af_sub1.description: Parameter populated by the advertiser in the attribution link

af_sub2.description: Parameter populated by the advertiser in the attribution link

af_sub3.description: Parameter populated by the advertiser in the attribution link

af_sub4.description: Parameter populated by the advertiser in the attribution link

af_sub5.description: Parameter populated by the advertiser in the attribution link

af_cost_model.description: Cost model reported on the attribution link

af_cost_value.description: Amount of Cost Currency, 4 digits after the decimal point permitted

af_cost_currency.description: 3-letter currency code that complies with ISO-4217, default is USD

contributor_1_af_prt.description: Agency or PMD - always converted to lowercase

contributor_2_af_prt.description: Agency or PMD - always converted to lowercase

contributor_3_af_prt.description: Agency or PMD - always converted to lowercase

region.description: Using the device IP address reported by the SDK

state.description: Using the device IP address reported by the SDK

city.description: The most granular location of the user based on the device IP. Usually, the value holds a city name, but it can also be districts, boroughs, etc., which are more accurate

postal_code.description: Using the device IP address reported by the SDK

dma.description: Designated Market Area or geographic areas

ip.description: IP address being IPV4 or IPV6. AppsFlyer uses the address to determine the user location. If needed, advertisers can mask the IP address from reports and postbacks

wifi.description: Set to either TRUE or FALSE

operator.description: The name of the mobile operator derived from the SIM MCCMNC. Available if the user is registered to the network using Android

carrier.description: The carrier name provided by Android

language.description: Language (locale) reported by the device and set by the device OS. Usually has the form ll-DD. Where ll is the language and DD is the dialect

appsflyer_id.description: A unique ID generated by the SDK when the app is installed on a device. The ID is used to attribute in-app events in LTV flows, fetch conversion data, and affiliate in-app events

advertising_id.description: User resettable advertising ID found on Android devices

idfa.description: User resettable advertising ID found on iOS devices

customer_user_id.description: A unique app user ID, set by the app owner

device_type.description: The commercial model name of the device. Starting Feb 2, 2022, this field is no longer populated. Instead of this field use Device model which is similarly populated

app_version.description: App version set by the advertiser

app_name.description: App name set by the advertiser

bundle_id.description: Bundle ID, identification to match either a single app or a group of apps in iOS

is_retargeting.description: True for retargeting conversions and events

retargeting_conversion_type.description: This field will be deprecated in the future. Use conversion_type and campaign_type to determine the context of the conversion

af_attribution_lookback.description: Maximum period of time when an install can be attributed to a specific ad

af_reengagement_window.description: Retargeting: The time period during which events are attributed to a retargeting campaign. The field is not populated in retargeting campaigns

is_primary_attribution.description: UA: True. Retargeting: During a re-engagement window, we attribute to both the original media source (before the re-engagement) and to the re-engagement media source. While the event is within the re-engagement window. The original media source will be FALSE (not primary attribution). The re-engagement media source will be TRUE

http_referrer.description: Identifies the address of the webpage that linked to the AppsFlyer click URL. By checking the referrer, you can see where the request originated

original_url.description: UA: Click/impression URL used. If the link is a Branded Link: the field is populated using the branded link. Retargeting: contains one of the following: Retargeting link, deep linking data, empty for SRNs

device_model.description: The commercial model name of the device

campaign_type.description: The source bringing the user: UA, Organic, Retargeting, Unknown.

conversion_type.description: The type of conversion: Install, Reinstall, Re-engagement, Unknown. If conversion_type=reinstall and campaign_type=retargeting is equivalent to retargeting_conversion_type=re-attribution

in_app_events_report.description: Batch-processed non-organic in-app events from Pull API

attributed_touch_type.description: Classifies the engagement. Set by AppsFlyer after the engagement was matched with an install

attributed_touch_time.description: Time of attributed touch, attributed engagement

install_time.description: UA: First launch after install. Retargeting: First launch after re-engagement/re-attribution

event_name.description: The attribution event type or the in-app event name sent by the app

event_value.description: Detailed event content sent from the SDK

event_revenue.description: Value of revenue using Event Revenue Currency

event_revenue_currency.description: The event revenue currency code reported to the SDK

event_revenue_usd.description: The amount of revenue. The currency will depend on the reporting tool used. Preferred or selected means the app-specific currency set in the app settings

is_receipt_validated.description: TRUE/FALSE/NULL when implemented in the SDK, empty otherwise

appsflyer_event.description: Real-time raw data from Push API

event_name.description: The attribution event type or the in-app event name sent by the app

impressions.description: Number of times that the user saw the ad

ip.description: IP address being IPV4 or IPV6, AppsFlyer uses the address to determine the user location

quality.query: SELECT count(*) as row_count FROM appsflyer_event

availability.description: The server is available during support hours

retention.description: Data is retained for one year

latency.description: Available in batch tables by 01:00 AM +07

freshness.description: Reflects data up to previous day

frequency.description: Data is delivered once a day

backup.description: Data is backed up once a week
